metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12390 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect origin serialization of URLs with IPv6 addresses could lead toincorrect security checks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 76.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
